var path = require('path'),
    fs = require('fs');

try {
  global.Gently = require('gently');
} catch (e) {
  throw new Error('this test suite requires node-gently');
}

exports.lib = path.join(__dirname, '../../lib');

global.GENTLY = new Gently();

global.assert = require('assert');
global.TEST_PORT = 13532;
global.TEST_FIXTURES = path.join(__dirname, '../fixture');
global.TEST_TMP = path.join(__dirname, '../tmp');
¶

Stupid new feature in node that complains about gently attaching too many listeners to process 'exit'. This is a workaround until I can think of a better way to deal with this.

 
if (process.setMaxListeners) {
  process.setMaxListeners(10000);
}
